edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme
Interface CmtWithProofsCommitter

All Superinterfaces:
CmtCommitter
All Known Implementing Classes:
CmtElGamalWithProofsCommitter, CmtPedersenWithProofsCommitter
public interface CmtWithProofsCommitter
extends CmtCommitter

This interface is used by the committer to prove that:

1. The committer knows the committed value.

2. The committed value was x.

All commitment scheme that have proofs should implement this interface.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

proveKnowledge

void proveKnowledge(long id)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           CheatAttemptException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Proves that the committer knows the committed value.

Parameters:
id - of the commitment message.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the commitment cannot be serialized
CheatAttemptException - if the committer suspects that the receiver attempted cheating
java.io.IOException - if there is any problem at the communication level

proveCommittedValue

void proveCommittedValue(long id)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                CheatAttemptException,
                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                CommitValueException
Proves that the committed value with the given id was x.

Parameters:
id - of the committed value.
Throws:
CommitValueException - if the commit value does not match the implementing commitment
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the commitment cannot be serialized
CheatAttemptException - if the committer suspects that the receiver attempted cheating
java.io.IOException - if there is any problem at the communication level
